page.title: 18Sport
page.content: The village is the centre for several sporting activities with cricket in the grounds of Chew Court, tennis at the Sacred Heart Convent, badminton in the Church Hall and table tennis at the Old Schoolroom. For the less energetic there is a skittle alley at the Queens Arms and another in a worse state of repair at the Old Schoolroom. Pub darts can be played at the Queens Arms and the Pelican and fishing is available on the River Chew and at Chew Magna Reservoir. Villagers are also extremely fortunate to be able to use sporting facilities at Chew Valley School which is home ground for the squash, rugby, badminton and hockey teams. Tennis is also available at Chew Valley School and for the lucky few there is a swimming pool at both the school and the convent.
